author: kevaundray
content:
Writing reason here incase itâ€™s not available anywhere else: each value is 32 bytes/256 bits, but the structure which will hold the values (field elements) can only store ~253 bits of information, it essentially truncates the top 3 bits away. So we instead split the 32-byte value into its low and high 128 bit components. 

Since we can only commit to 256 things with pedersen, and each suffix node holds 256 32-byte values, when we split it up, we will have 512 values, so we need two commitments to commit to all of the values.
